v: trusting in their soldiers’ horses and their many chariots and their many chariot drivers,
instead of trusting that Yahweh, the Holy One of Israel, will help them.
but he also causes people to experience disaster!
And when he decides to do that,
he does not change his mind!
He will strike the wicked people
and all those who help them.
And their horses are only horses; they are not powerful spirits!
So when Yahweh raises his fist
to strike the soldiers of Egypt whom you thought would help you,
he will also strike you who thought that you would be helped,
and you and they will stumble and fall down;
all of you will die together.

v.v: But this is what Yahweh said to me:
Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, will protect Jerusalem

v: “When a lion stands and growls over the body of a sheep that he has killed,
even if a large group of shepherds comes to chase away the lion,
even if they shout loudly,
the lion will not be afraid and will not leave.
Similarly, I, Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, will come down
to fight my enemies on Mount Zion,
and nothing will stop me.
like a mother bird hovers over the baby birds in her nest.
He will defend the city
and rescue it from its enemies.”

v.v: My people, even though you have greatly rebelled against Yahweh, return to him.
When you do that, each of you will throw away the idols that you have made in sin, idols that are covered with silver and gold.
The Assyrian soldiers will be killed,
Even their very strong soldiers will be terrified;
Listen to this! Some day there will be a righteous king,
Each of them will be like a shelter from the wind
When that happens, those leaders will enable people who have not understood God’s truth to understand it,
Even those who act very hastily will have good sense,
At that time, people who are foolish will no longer be admired,
Foolish people say things that are foolish,
Scoundrels do things that are evil and that deceive people;
But honorable people plan to do honorable things,
You women of Jerusalem who think that you are very secure
After one year is ended, you who now are not worried about anything will tremble,
So tremble now, you women who are not worried about anything!
You will wail because you are grieving about what will happen in your fertile fields and to your fruitful grapevines,
because only thorns and thistles will grow in your soil.
The king’s palace will be empty;
It will be like that until God pours his Spirit out on us from heaven.
People will act justly in those desert areas,
The result of their acting righteously will be that there will be peace,
My people will live in their homes peacefully, and safely, and calmly,
Even if a severe hailstorm knocks down the trees in the forest,
Yahweh will greatly bless you;
Terrible things will happen to you people of Assyria!
Yahweh, act kindly toward us,
Our enemies run away when they hear your voice.
And after our enemies have been defeated,
Yahweh is greater than anyone else, and he lives in heaven,
When that happens, he will enable you to live securely;
But now, look, our messengers are crying out in the streets;
No one travels on our roads.
The land of Judah is dry and barren.
Yahweh says, “Now I will arise and show that I deserve for everyone to honor me.
You people of Assyria make plans that are as useless as chaff and straw.
Your people will be burned until only ashes remain,
You people who live far away and you people who live nearby,
The sinners in Jerusalem will tremble because they are very afraid;
Those who act honestly and say what is right,
they are the people who will live safely;
You people of Judah will see the king wearing all his beautiful robes,
When you see that, you will think about when you were previously terrified,
Those arrogant people who spoke a language that we could not understand are no longer here!”
At that time, you will see Mount Zion, the place where we celebrate our festivals;
Yahweh will be our mighty God;
Yahweh is our judge;
The ropes on our enemies’ boats will hang loose,
And the people in Jerusalem will no longer say, “We are sick,”
You people of all nations, come near and listen;
Yahweh is angry with the people of all nations;
Their corpses will not be buried,
The sky will disappear like a scroll that is rolled up and thrown away.
When Yahweh has finished his work of destroying objects in the sky,
It is as though Yahweh will have a sword that is covered with blood and fat—
Even wild oxen will be killed,
That will be the time when Yahweh gets revenge
The streams in Edom will be full of burning pitch,
Yahweh will never finish punishing Edom with fire;
Ravens and various kinds of owls and small animals will live there.
There will be no more princes;
The deserted palaces and fortified buildings will be full of thorns and thistles.
Animals that live in the desert and hyenas will be there,
Owls will make their nests there and lay their eggs in the nests;

v: but not by swords that men use.
They will be destroyed by the sword of God;
and those who are not killed will panic and flee.
And some of them will be captured and forced to become slaves.
their leaders will abandon all hope and run away from Yahweh’s power!
Yahweh’s presence on Mount Zion is like a fire,
like a furnace that blazes in Jerusalem.
This is what Yahweh says about the Assyrian army!
